decks.notes: This aggressive deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of low-cost creatures and powerful spells. By utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, it seeks to quickly deal damage and control the battlefield. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide extra protection and disruption, while Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer big threats to close out the game. The deck's varied mana base allows for flexibility in casting its spells and maintaining pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Tower, and Mine) combined with Expedition Map to search for missing pieces. The deck focuses on controlling the board with powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths, as well as removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional control and win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and powerful spells while keeping the board in check.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls to quickly deal damage to the opponent. With cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah providing additional ways to pressure the opponent, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive game plan. The inclusion of cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison help to control the board and protect the key creatures, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer provide additional card advantage to maintain momentum.

The deck focuses on using various mill cards and creatures like Hedron Crab and Ruin Crab to deplete the opponent's library quickly. It also utilizes cards like Archive Trap and Tasha's Hideous Laughter to accelerate the milling process. Control elements like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch help to eliminate threats from the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The deck aims to mill the opponent's entire deck as fast as possible to win the game through deck depletion. Additionally, cards like Jace, the Perfected Mind and Visions of Beyond provide card advantage and additional win conditions.

The main strategy of this deck is to gain control of the game by utilizing a mix of removal spells, counter spells, and powerful creatures such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck also includes various card draw and selection engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Meticulous Archive to maintain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of white, blue, and black, with fetch lands to ensure consistency in mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence to secure victory.

The deck focuses on mana ramping and controlling the board through powerful Eldrazi creatures and artifacts. It aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana quickly, allowing for the early deployment of threats like Thought-Knot Seer and the ability to lock opponents out with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. Various disruption spells and removal provide additional control elements, while the combo potential of the deck can overwhelm opponents in the late game.

This deck focuses on gaining an advantage by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses control elements such as Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying powerful threats like Ugin, Karn, and Eldrazi creatures. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful late-game plays, utilizing the synergy between the UrzaTron lands and high-impact spells and creatures.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers, utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate significant amounts of mana. Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer disrupt opponent's strategies, while Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms provide additional control and removal options. The deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands quickly to cast massive threats like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust, overwhelming opponents with powerful spells and creatures while maintaining board control.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing mana to play multiple threats each turn, while also using powerful removal like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Galvanic Discharge to control the board. Cards like Ocelot Pride and Guide of Souls help generate extra value from attacking creatures, while powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional pressure. The deck aims to close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and Eldrazi creatures to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. It aims to quickly accelerate mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, allowing for early plays of big Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes removal and disruption spells like Kozilek's Command and Ghost Quarter to control the board and hinder the opponent's strategy. The deck's strategy is to establish an early advantage and quickly close out the game with its powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards such as Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending. It also utilizes instant speed reanimation in combination with Atraxa, Grand Unifier and powerful removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on efficiency and flexibility, allowing for quick combos and disrupting the opponent's plays while maintaining a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with cheap artifact creatures and using artifacts such as Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to enhance their power. It also utilizes utility artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, while also having access to counter spells like Metallic Rebuke for disruption. Urza's Saga provides additional value by searching for key artifacts, making this deck a potent Aggro - Affinity archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on consistently and quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo, using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to search for the necessary pieces. The deck includes various ways to protect the combo, such as Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer. Additionally, cards like Generous Ent and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant help ramp up mana quickly to facilitate the combo. As a result, the deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn by casting Griselbrand or Ureni, the Song Unending thanks to the combo pieces assembled.

This deck focuses on using cheap spells to pump up creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal quick damage and pressure the opponent. It also utilizes cantrips like Preordain and Mishra's Bauble to draw cards and find the necessary cards to win the game. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off opponents or clear blockers. The goal is to maintain a fast-paced, aggressive strategy that overwhelms the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck relies on a toolbox of creature cards that can be searched for and played at the right moment to create powerful combo synergies. It aims to assemble specific creature combinations, such as Cauldron Familiar and Carrion Feeder, to generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck incorporates cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual to help find and cast these creatures quickly. By utilizing a range of efficient creatures and combo pieces, this deck can adapt to different situations and outmaneuver opponents in a variety of ways.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and medallions, allowing for explosive spell casting. The combo involves casting multiple spells in a single turn to trigger abilities from cards like Questing Druid and Ral, Monsoon Mage. By utilizing Wish to fetch specific cards from the sideboard and Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard, the deck aims to create a storm of spells and overwhelming the opponent with damage from cards like Grapeshot. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed to achieve victory.
